Position tab for IMBs
On the Position tab, you can change the origin (top-left corner) of the Intelligent Mail barcode (IMB), the size of the barcode area, and the
orientation of the barcode symbol.
When you create BCOCA IMBs, the barcode area must be large enough to contain the largest barcode symbol in each page group. If any part of
the barcode symbol extends outside of the barcode area, the printer reports an exception and does not print the barcode correctly.
AFP Editor automatically creates IMBs with the same orientation as the POSTNET barcodes. However, you can select a different orientation for the
barcode symbol (0, 90, 180, 270 degrees).

Placement of area Page n The barcode is placed on page n of each page group. n is the number of the page
where you drew the barcode area.
Multiple pages: All pages The barcode is placed on all pages in each page group.
Multiple pages: Even The barcode is placed on the even pages in each page group (pages 2, 4, 6,...).

Multiple pages: Odd The barcode is placed on the odd pages in each page group (pages 1, 3, 5,...).
